block.p: Elizabeth Paige Weld, the daughter of Jane and Jonathan Weld of Brooklyn, was married yesterday to David Tien-jen Wei, the son of Rita and Irvine Wei of Lexington, Mass. The Rev. Wayne E. Jacobson, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony at the summer home of the bride's parents in Stony Creek, Conn.

Mrs. Wei, 29, was until last week a fourth-grade teacher at Grace Church School in Manhattan. In September she will begin teaching the fourth grade at the Fenn School in Concord, Mass. She graduated cum laude from Harvard University and received a master's degree in education from the Bank Street College of Education. Her father is a partner in Shearman & Sterling, the law firm in New York. Her mother is a Christian Science practitioner in Brooklyn.

Elizabeth Paige Weld, the daughter of Jane and Jonathan Weld of Brooklyn, was married yesterday to David Tien-jen Wei, the son of Rita and Irvine Wei of Lexington, Mass. The Rev. Wayne E. Jacobson, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony at the summer home of the bride's parents in Stony Creek, Conn.

Mrs. Wei, 29, was until last week a fourth-grade teacher at Grace Church School in Manhattan. In September she will begin teaching the fourth grade at the Fenn School in Concord, Mass. She graduated cum laude from Harvard University and received a master's degree in education from the Bank Street College of Education. Her father is a partner in Shearman & Sterling, the law firm in New York. Her mother is a Christian Science practitioner in Brooklyn.

Mr. Wei, 29, is the database administrator in Cambridge, Mass., for UCB, a Belgian pharmaceutical, chemical and film manufacturer. He graduated from Duke University and received a master's degree in biomedical engineering from the Medical College of Virginia. His father is a professor of environmental engineering at Northeastern University in Boston.
